titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rollin D. Hotchkiss papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA168

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-07 00:17:35 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rollin D. Hotchkiss papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Chemical samples received from Professor Rollin D. Hotchkiss, through Mrs. René J. Dubos, May 1982.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Chemical samples (received from Professor Rollin D. Hotchkiss).
1145 Sphingosine Sulphate C=63.60 H=11.20 N=3.82 S=3.88
1123 (partly erased) Sphingomyelin. (_free). C=67.00% H=11.40% N=3.42% P=3.55%
Wallerstein Company... Special Tyrothricin Defatted. 15 gms. See ltr. dtd. October 23, 1951 to Dr. R.J. Dubos.
Gramicidin. Crystalline. Wallerstein Labs. 5 Grams. M.P. 228°C. 11-30-1944.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, correspondence, subject files, lectures, notes, reprints, and manuscripts.

did.unittitle: Honorary degrees Yale 1962, Hungarian Academy of Sciences 1976, University of Paris 1980
NY Times Magazine article, with photos of RDH lab
Manci Kohoutová - family and lab staff
RDH, Sold Goodgal, Norton Zinder at Oak Ridge
Florida, University of Research and lectures
Personal letters, mostly to RDH from members of lab
miscellaneous letters about other than genetics, DNA

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See Appendix I end of listing for description.

did.unittitle: Academic courses participated in (Cold Spring Harbor, RU, Berkeley, NYU)
Leaves of absence, visiting professorships (MIT, Corpus Christi, Hungary, Utah)
RDH article for Genetics, includes reprint
Memorial, includes MS of RDH talk
Woolley, D.W. [primarily material collected by Dr. E.L. Tatum for a biography of Dr. Woolley for the NAS]

Miscellaneous mss, abstracts for papers, and remarks

Reviews of grant applications on transformation
Reviews of manuscripts for Analytical Biochemistry; Biochemistry
Reviews of manuscripts on DNA genetic transformation

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials received 1 November 1985 from Dr. Hotchkiss

did.unittitle: Society of Cell Biology, Journal of Cell Biology
Experimental work with Khorana, project on oligonucleotide synthesis
Lab notebook: "Computation Book. I. Gramicidin. September 1940 to September 1941"
Lab notebook: "Computation Book. III. Gramicidin-Tyrocidine Chemistry. September 1941 to [ca 1942]"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boxes 9-11 consist primarily of laboratory notes and notebooks.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The folders were inventoried in the order per Dr. Hotchkiss's "A6" code (A=Archives, 6=1986) ; cf. Dr. Hotchkiss's remarks recorded for the Archives on the scientific work documented by these notes.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Processing note: The material has been refoldered into acid-free folders; overstuffed folders have been divided into two or more folders. The notes on single sheets have been kept in their original order, with paper clips removed. Care should be taken that the order of the notes is not disturbed, until the pages are numbered or annotated.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Most of the folders are labeled: an original label along the top margin, and additional identification and code number added by Dr. Hotchkiss ca 1986 on the front cover of the folder. These labels have been trimmed from the original folders and are preserved in envelopes in front of the laboratory notes. Only brief titles are given in the inventory here.

did.unittitle: Albany 1986. Photocopies of announcement re RDH honorary degree. School of Public Health Sciences, 21 March 1986; newspaper clipping, ms of RDH remarks, "Cycles in genetics and the academic metabolism"
A62f Staph. Phosphate and amino acids
A63a Lucy Paige (Sheffield). Lab notes Book #2
